The city is easily accessible by plane, train, and car. The main attraction of Grafenwöhr is the training area and historical buildings, including a military museum. Visitors can also enjoy local specialties offered in various places throughout the city. Hotel Restaurant Böhm is a great option for affordable and good quality stays with free WiFi. Overall, Grafenwöhr is a unique tourist destination that offers a glimpse into military history and culture.

Emmerich am Rhein is a charming city in North Rhine-Westphalia, Germany, with a population of around 30,000. It is situated on the right bank of the River Rhine, next to the Dutch border, and is divided into 10 quarters. The city is easily accessible by air, with several airports located nearby, including Weeze, Düsseldorf, Eindhoven, Dortmund, and Schiphol. Emmerich station is also conveniently located less than 1 km away from the city centre and is connected to high-speed trains and regional trains. The city is also well-connected by road, with access to the A3 highway and federal highways B8 and B220.

Emmerich am Rhein is a popular tourist destination, with several attractions to explore. The Rheinbrücke Emmerich is a must-visit, offering stunning views of the river and the surrounding landscape. The Heilig-Geist-Kirche is another popular attraction, known for its beautiful architecture and rich history. The Rheinmuseum is also worth a visit, providing visitors with an insight into the city's past and present.

There are several accommodation options available in Emmerich am Rhein, including hotels and caravan sites, making it an ideal destination for both short and long stays. With its picturesque location, rich history, and numerous attractions, Emmerich am Rhein is a great place to visit for anyone looking to explore the beauty of Germany.

Kleve is a charming town and district in Western Germany, known for its extensive parks and gardens dating back to the Baroque era. It was once a popular spa town until the spring dried up in 1914. The town is easily accessible by train, bus, and plane, with hourly buses from Nijmegen in the Netherlands. Getting around is best done on foot or by bike, with dedicated cycleways and bus connections to surrounding areas. 

Tourists can explore the Schwanenburg, Museum Kurhaus Kleve, B.C. Koekkoek-Haus, and several churches. The town also has a theater, restaurants, and hotels for visitors. Nearby attractions include Schloss Moyland and several other towns in Germany and the Netherlands. With its rich history and beautiful landscapes, Kleve is a must-visit destination for anyone looking to explore Western Germany.

Rheine is a charming town located in the Münsterland region, with a population of 75,000. It is situated on the border with Lower Saxony and is easily accessible by intercity and regional trains, as well as by Autobahn A 30 and A 1. Munich, the capital of Bavaria in southern Germany, is a popular tourist destination known for its architecture, culture, history, Oktoberfest, and sports events. The Harz region in Germany is a popular tourist destination known for its historic silver mines, terraced plateaus, and forest scenery in the Harz National Park. Uelzen is a charming town in northeast Lower Saxony, Germany, known for its picturesque timber-framed buildings and North German brick Gothic architecture. Rathen is a charming spa town located in Saxon Switzerland, Germany, that offers a variety of transportation options, including plane, train, bus, boat, and bicycle. The village is easily walkable, and visitors can enjoy a steep but rewarding ascent to the Bastei rock formation, which offers breathtaking views of the Elbe Sandstone Mountains. Other attractions include the Felsenburg Neurathen castle ruins and the Felsenbühne Rathen open-air theatre. There are plenty of places to eat and drink, including the Bastei Berghotel, and souvenir shops selling typical tourist items. Accommodation options are available on the town website, including a beer garden in the summer. Nearby attractions include Königstein fortress, Bad Schandau spa town, and Dresden, and the Czech Republic is easily accessible by train. Overall, Rathen is a must-visit destination for anyone looking to experience the natural beauty and cultural richness of Germany.

Kiel is a coastal city in Germany that serves as a major passenger port and shipping endpoint. Despite being heavily bombed during World War II, Kiel has rebuilt and offers a variety of transportation options, including a good public transport system, bike rentals, and electric scooters. The city is home to several museums, including the German Baltic fleet, and hosts the world's largest sailing event, Kieler Woche, at the end of June. Kiel also offers a public library, sports teams, and physical activity options, as well as shopping and dining options ranging from budget to splurge. The old city centre is known for its cafes and pubs, and the city has various clubs and concert venues. Accommodation options include budget to splurge, with free Wi-Fi available in some areas. Nearby cities to visit include Lübeck, Neumünster, Plön, Rendsburg, and Schleswig.

Plön is a charming town located in Schleswig-Holstein, Germany, that is easily accessible by various modes of transportation. The town is renowned for its picturesque lakes and offers visitors the opportunity to explore several historic churches, towers, and palaces. Visitors can enjoy a range of outdoor activities, including hiking, sailing, and canoeing. The town also boasts a variety of dining options, including a steak and pizza restaurant and a lakeside hotel and restaurant. Accommodation is available at a youth hostel. Nearby cities such as Kiel and Lübeck are also worth visiting. Overall, Plön is an ideal tourist destination for those seeking a peaceful and scenic getaway.

Bad Segeberg is a small town in Schleswig Holstein, Germany that is primarily known for its annual Karl May festival. The festival celebrates the works of German author Karl May, who wrote westerns and books set in the Middle East. The town is accessible by train or car and has limited attractions besides the festival and a recognized spa. The main sight is the Segeberger Kalkberg, a mountain made of gypsum and anhydrite that serves as the backdrop for the festival. There are a few options for accommodation in the town. Visitors can enjoy the festival's various activities, including live performances, parades, and market stalls. The town's spa offers a range of treatments and therapies for those looking to relax and unwind. Bad Segeberg is a great destination for those interested in German literature and culture, as well as those looking for a peaceful retreat in a scenic location. Overall, Bad Segeberg is a charming town that offers a unique cultural experience for visitors.

Berchtesgaden is a small town in Bavaria, Germany, surrounded by high mountains and famous for its salt mines. It gained notoriety in the 20th century as the location of Adolf Hitler's summer getaway, the Berghof, which was destroyed after World War II. The Kehlsteinhaus, also known as "The Eagles Nest," is now a restaurant accessible by bus. Berchtesgaden is a popular tourist destination and is well connected by train and road, with the nearest airport in Munich. Visitors can enjoy hiking, boat trips, and skiing, and there are many restaurants offering local food at reasonable prices. The top attractions include the Kehlsteinhaus, Königssee, Jenner Mountain, Berchtesgaden Salt Mine, Rossfeld panoramatic road, Obersalzbergbahn, Almbachklamm, and Wimbachklamm. Berchtesgaden and nearby Königsee offer world-class sports facilities, including a bobsleigh run, ice arena, and skiing slopes. Accommodation ranges from budget to moderately expensive, including bed and breakfast options and holiday flats. Nearby destinations include Schönau a.Königssee, Bad Reichenhall, Munich, and Salzburg.

Preetz is a charming town in the Schleswig-Holstein region of Germany, known as the "Schusterstadt" or Shoemaker's Town. With a population of 16,000, it is located between the Post and Lake Lankersee and is easily accessible by bus, train, car, or bike. The town has a rich history, evident in its several churches, Slavic ring wall, and tower hill castle. Visitors can explore the town's past by hiking or biking along the Schusteracht path. For those looking to shop, there is a shopping center near the railway station. Foodies will enjoy the town's Greek restaurant, while those looking for a cozy place to stay can check out the bed and breakfast. Overall, Preetz is a great destination for those looking to experience a small German town with a rich history and plenty of outdoor activities.

Rendsburg is a charming town in Schleswig-Holstein, Germany, with a population of over 28,000 people. Its main attraction is its location on the Kiel Canal, which boasts a major railway bridge over the canal. The town has a rich history of changing hands between Danish and German control, and was finally seized by the Kingdom of Prussia and Austria in the German-Danish War in 1864. Today, Rendsburg is a popular tourist destination, with plenty to see and do. Visitors can marvel at the Rendsburg High Bridge, the longest railway bridge in Europe, and the Kiel Canal Pedestrian Tunnel, the longest pedestrian tunnel in the world. The town also has a swimming center, restaurants, and a hotel. Nearby destinations include Kiel, Neumünster, and Schleswig. Whether you're interested in history, engineering, or simply enjoying the beautiful scenery, Rendsburg is definitely worth a visit.

Eckernförde is a charming city located in Southern Schleswig, situated in the picturesque Kiel Bay. It is a popular tourist destination, offering a range of attractions and activities for visitors to enjoy. The city boasts a train station, making it easily accessible for travelers. Visitors can explore the city's rich history and culture by visiting its many museums and churches. One of the most popular attractions is the fish smokehouse, where visitors can sample delicious local seafood. Accommodation options are limited, with only one hotel listed for visitors to stay in. Overall, Eckernförde is a must-visit destination for those looking to experience the beauty and charm of Southern Schleswig.

Friedrichstadt is a charming town in Schleswig-Holstein, Germany that was founded in the 17th century to provide a home for religious refugees from the Netherlands. The town is renowned for its remarkable religious tolerance and Dutch-inspired urban design, complete with canals that visitors can explore on foot or by boat. The town is home to various churches of different denominations, making it a fascinating destination for those interested in religious history. In addition to its religious heritage, Friedrichstadt offers a range of dining and accommodation options, making it an ideal destination for tourists. Visitors can enjoy a leisurely stroll through the town's picturesque streets, taking in the beautiful architecture and charming atmosphere. Alternatively, they can take a boat tour of the canals, which offers a unique perspective on the town's history and culture. Overall, Friedrichstadt is a must-visit destination for anyone interested in history, architecture, and culture, and is sure to leave a lasting impression on all who visit.

Büsum is a charming fishing and tourist town located on the North Sea coast in Schleswig Holstein, Germany. It is a popular summer vacation spot for families and day trips from Hamburg, known for its Büsumer Krabben. The town was once an island with three villages, but devastating floods destroyed most of it. Today, it is a small and easily navigable town that offers a range of attractions for visitors. 

Tourists can explore the Büsum Lighthouse, City Hall, Museum am Meer, Museumshafen Büsum, and St. Clemens church. The town is famous for its Krabben, which can be purchased directly off the boat. Visitors can stay in unique accommodations such as Schlafstrandkorb or hotels like Hotel Schelf and Küstenperle. Camping options are also available. 

Büsum offers a science museum called Phänomania and trips to the sea for pleasure or fishing. It is a good place to take children on a rainy day or to let out your inner child. The town was bombed during World War II but is now easily accessible by train, plane, and boat. Overall, Büsum is a charming and picturesque destination that offers a range of activities and attractions for tourists.

Husum is a charming city located on the North Sea coast of Schleswig-Holstein, Germany. It offers a unique blend of city life, nature, and North Frisian tradition. The city has a population of 23,000 people and is famous for being the birthplace of Theodor Storm, a renowned poet. Husum has a rich history with storm floods, which led to the construction of the Husum port. Visitors can explore several museums, churches, and other sites, including swimming pools and events such as the Crocus flowering. The city also offers a variety of dining and drinking options, as well as accommodations ranging from camping sites to luxury hotels. Husum is an ideal destination for tourists looking to experience the beauty of the North Sea coast while immersing themselves in the local culture and history. Visitors can easily connect to their next destination from Husum.

Flensburg is a city in Schleswig-Holstein, Germany, with a population of 90,000 inhabitants. It is known for being a border town and the headquarters of the central registry for traffic offenses committed throughout Germany. The city has a strong Danish minority and a German majority, with a history of being bilingual or even trilingual. Many Danes come to Flensburg to buy goods, while people from Flensburg like to hop across the border to places like Sønderborg to sight-see or shop. The best way to get around the city centre is by walking.

Flensburg offers a variety of attractions for tourists, including museums, churches, historical buildings, spectator sports, ferry tours, and theaters. The Museumsberg Flensburg exhibits local history artifacts and art, while the Naturwissenschaftliches Museum is a science museum. The Schifffahrtsmuseum is dedicated to Flensburg's maritime history. Other museums include the interactive science museum Phänomenta and the Shipyard museum. There are also several churches to visit, such as the 15th-century Nikolai-Apotheke and the Naval Academy Mürwik.

Flensburg is also known for its shopping, with numerous shops along the pedestrian street Holm and major malls like Fördepark and Scandinavien Park. The city has budget-friendly dining options like Strandgut and Pizzateca da Tonis, as well as mid-range and splurge restaurants. Accommodations range from a hotel outside the city center to a hostel and a youth hostel.

For those interested in exploring nearby cities, Flensburg is conveniently located near Kiel, Lübeck, Hamburg, and Schleswig. Overall, Flensburg offers a unique blend of German and Danish culture, history, and entertainment, making it a great tourist destination.

Fehmarn is a popular tourist destination located in the southern Baltic Sea, belonging to Schleswig-Holstein, Germany. The island is mostly made up of farmland and has a population of 12,000. It is connected to mainland Germany by a road bridge and has a harbor with frequent ferries from Rødby in Denmark. The island is known for its beautiful birding spots and has several tourist attractions, including windmills, lighthouses, and a waterbird reserve. Fehmarn is also home to several border shops that sell consumer goods to tourists from Denmark and Sweden. The island is currently undergoing a major infrastructure project that will replace the aging bridge across Fehmarnsund and build a new tunnel under Fehmarnbelt for both motorcars and trains. This will make it easier for tourists to access the island. Overall, Fehmarn is a great destination for those looking to explore the natural beauty of the Baltic Sea and experience the unique culture of Schleswig-Holstein.

Tönning is a charming small town in Schleswig Holstein that offers a peaceful and relaxing vacation experience. The town boasts a beautiful beach with soft silt deposits that are believed to have healing properties for skin diseases. Visitors can enjoy cycling around the town and taking in the North Frisian small town flair and historic buildings. The town has good infrastructure and can be easily reached by train. Tourists interested in culture will find plenty to explore in Tönning, including popular sights like the Multimar Wattforum and St. Laurentius. For those looking for outdoor activities, the Eider Barrage is a great bike trip. The town also has a saltwater open-air pool and a few places to eat and sleep. Husum, a popular shopping destination, is just a short train ride away. Overall, Tönning is a great destination for those seeking a quieter vacation with plenty of opportunities for relaxation and exploration.

Sylt is a popular and expensive holiday destination in Germany, known for its 40-km white beach, dunes, and mudflats. The island is connected to the mainland by a railway-only causeway and has an airport and a year-round ferry. Visitors can get around by bus or bike, and there are four main cities, with Westerland being the main one. The island's main attractions include Denghoog, Rotes Kliff, Uwe Düne, and the Wandering Dunes of List. Sylt is a popular beach destination, with several segments of the beach designated as FKK (nudist). Visitors can rent a Strandkorb and hike along the beach or the paths in the dunes and heath behind the beach. The island is known for its seafood, with fish burgers being a popular takeaway specialty. There are budget, mid-range, and splurge dining options available, as well as various bars and clubs. Accommodations range from a youth hostel to hotels and a camping site. Visitors can also explore nearby destinations listed in the "Go next" section.
